dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's from a new report in the Washington Post. The Trump administration is actively trying to strip that funding out of the next stimulus bill.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's from a new report in the Washington Post. The Trump administration is actively trying to strip that funding out of the next stimulus bill.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As Congress races to come together on a fifth coronavirus stimulus package with cases skyrocketing across the country, the Trump administration is actively working to block billions of dollars in federal funding for testing and the Centers for Disease Control, according to a new report from the Washington Post.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And they've got just 11 days to get this package together before the August recess. It's a frantic push.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they've got just eleven days to get this package together before the August recess. It's a frantic push.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Congress is readying for a frantic push to come together on a fifth coronavirus stimulus package with just 11 days to act before lawmakers break for August recess and as the U.S. continues to break records for new daily cases.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild that this is happening while cases are skyrocketing across the country. Like, we're breaking records every day.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's wild that this is happening while cases are skyrocketing across the country. Like, we're breaking records every day.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Congress is readying for a frantic push to come together on a fifth coronavirus stimulus package with just 11 days to act before lawmakers break for August recess and as the U.S. continues to break records for new daily cases.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And it's not just testing—they're also trying to cut funding for the State Department and the Pentagon's pandemic response, according to that same article.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's not just testing-they're also trying to cut funding for the State Department and the Pentagon's pandemic response, according to that same article.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Trump administration is also attempting to reduce funding in the GOP proposal for the State Department and the Pentagon to fight the pandemic, the Post reports.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But some GOP senators are pushing back, right? They're angry about the White House request.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But some G O P senators are pushing back, right? They're angry about the White House request.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The White House request has reportedly angered GOP senators, and some Republicans have pushed back, adamant the funding should stay in the bill.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they want that money to stay in the bill. I mean, Senate Republicans themselves proposed $25 billion for testing and contact tracing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they want that money to stay in the bill. I mean, Senate Republicans themselves proposed twenty five dollars billion for testing and contact tracing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The amount of money Senate Republicans want to include for testing and contact tracing, according to the Washington Post.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is interestingly the same amount that was approved back in April—and apparently some officials think that money hasn't even been spent yet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is interestingly the same amount that was approved back in April-and apparently some officials think that money hasn't even been spent yet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Post reports that some White House officials believe money approved for testing has been unspent (the coronavirus spending package passed in April included $25 billion for testing.)

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, Trump keeps swiping at the CDC. He disagreed with Director Redfield's mask guidance last week.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, Trump keeps swiping at the C D C. He disagreed with Director Redfield's mask guidance last week.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Post report comes as Trump continues to swipe at the CDC: on Friday, the president said he doesnt agree with the CDC director Robert Redfields mask guidance and earlier, the Trump administration stripped the agency of control over coronavirus data and blocked Redfield from testifying to Congress on school reopenings.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And blocked him from testifying to Congress about school reopenings. The mixed messages from the administration are just... staggering.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And blocked him from testifying to Congress about school reopenings. The mixed messages from the administration are just... staggering.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Post report comes as Trump continues to swipe at the CDC: on Friday, the president said he doesnt agree with the CDC director Robert Redfields mask guidance and earlier, the Trump administration stripped the agency of control over coronavirus data and blocked Redfield from testifying to Congress on school reopenings.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Treasury Secretary Mnuchin wants another round of stimulus checks and maybe even extending some unemployment benefits, but others in the White House are pushing for things like a payroll tax holiday.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Treasury Secretary Mnuchin wants another round of stimulus checks and maybe even extending some unemployment benefits, but others in the White House are pushing for things like a payroll tax holiday.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin is pressing for another round of stimulus checks and even extending some variation of the $600 expanded unemployment program in a next bill, while other administration officials want to work around the edges with proposals like a payroll tax holiday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It sounds like there's an epic clash happening behind the scenes. No wonder Congress can't get on the same page.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It sounds like there's an epic clash happening behind the scenes. No wonder Congress can't get on the same page.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Trump administration has sent mixed messages about its priorities for a fifth package, part of an epic clash occurring in the White House, Fox Business reported this week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Schumer said they haven't heard a peep from McConnell or the Republicans on any proposal, which is just... frustrating.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Schumer said they haven't heard a peep from McConnell or the Republicans on any proposal, which is just... frustrating.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We have not heard a peep from McConnell or the Republicans or the administration on any proposal, even though we've been asking for weeks and weeks and weeks, Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.) said on a conference call Friday about the GOP stimulus bill, CNN reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: You know what's surprising? Even former Chief of Staff Mark Meadows wrote an op-ed saying we still have a testing problem in this country.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You know what's surprising? Even former Chief of Staff Mark Meadows wrote an op-ed saying we still have a testing problem in this country.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Former White House Chief of Staff Mick Mulvaney penned an op-ed in CNBC this week in which he argued the U.S. still has a testing problem.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, he said any stimulus should be directed at dealing with COVID—the root cause of the recession. Not exactly a popular take in some Republican circles.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, he said any stimulus should be directed at dealing with COVID-the root cause of the recession. Not exactly a popular take in some Republican circles.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Any stimulus should be directed at the root cause of our recession: dealing with Covid, Mulvaney writes. I know it isnt popular to talk about in some Republican circles, but we still have a testing problem in this country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But it's the truth. Labs are backlogged, results are taking five to seven days in some places. We're not out of this yet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's the truth. Labs are backlogged, results are taking five to seven days in some places. We're not out of this yet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Now, the main problem appears to be a backlog at labs across the country. This week, the Washington Post reported that some testing sites are taking five to seven days to deliver results to patients.
